meanings.definition: Adapted in advance for a specific purpose or environment.
meanings.sent1: The preadaptive design of the bird's beak helped it catch insects easily.
meanings.sent2: The preadaptive features of the plant allowed it to thrive in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The preadaptive umbrella opened automatically when it sensed rain.
meanings.sent4: Her preadaptive instincts kicked in, guiding her through the unfamiliar forest.
meanings.sent5: The preadaptive camouflage of the chameleon made it almost invisible in the jungle.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics that make it suitable for a particular function or environment before the need arises.
meanings.sent1: The preadaptive skills of the team made them excel in the competition.
meanings.sent2: His preadaptive behavior in emergencies always kept him calm and collected.
meanings.sent3: The preadaptive flashlight turned on automatically in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The preadaptive nature of the plant allowed it to survive harsh conditions.
meanings.sent5: The preadaptive instincts of the squirrel helped it gather food efficiently.
